result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melodie Monique Bell

defendant.name: Bell, Melodie Monique

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melodie Monique Bell not in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson appeared by video for Melodie Monique Bell.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Status conference held.  Atty. Anderson requests another status date so he can determine what is going to happen with defendant's felony case. Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This hearing will be heard via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Melodie Monique Bell not in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson not in court.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Matter set for status conference.  Defendant is in custody and counsel did not appear.  Defendant has 2 felony cases set for preliminary hearing on 10/20/22.Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Melodie Monique Bell not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin.
OFF THE RECORD.
SPD has not yet appointed counsel. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with YDA, Officer Brian Baker, Officer Joshua Graminiski, JSW.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, bail to revert to $1,000.00 .  If alternative Cash Bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list. 24 hour curfew with the exception for verfied work, court appearances, medical appointments, and attorney appointments.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  Court ordered random drug testing.
  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Melodie Monique Bell in court with attorney Katherine Elizabeth Holloway.  Defendant Melodie Monique Bell in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
